content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a risk-averse individual, I would prefer to choose the option that provides a consistent and secure outcome over the long term. In this game, choosing 'B' guarantees a payoff of $12 per round, whereas choosing 'R' offers a higher payoff ($45) if my opponent chooses the same but also carries the risk of earning nothing ($0).

When considering 75 rounds, it is important to compare the total potential earnings for each choice. By choosing 'B', I will earn $900 (75 * $12), whereas choosing 'R' could potentially yield more if my opponent consistently chooses 'R' as well. However, there is a higher chance that my opponent may choose 'B', resulting in lower overall earnings for me ($42 per round when I pick 'R' and they pick 'B').

Given the high number of rounds and my preference for security, I would likely choose 'B' to minimize the risk of low earnings. Thus, my choice would be {B}.
